review_title: We're for children, young people, families and not least, our amazing group of employees
job_title: People and Culture Manager in Richmond, Victoria
pros: Family friendly, flexible, great group of people all here for a mutual purpose. Working with amazing children, young people and families that inspire you every day. Having a great team around you to support you in tough times but also there to celebrate the successes.
cons: The nature of working with young people and families who experience significant trauma in their lives. Working with victim survivors of family violence. The risk of vicarious trauma - but this is why Berry Street wraps around supports for our staff.

pros: I've worked for private companies and Government but Berry Street easily stands out as the best place to work. Friendly culture Career progression Management are focused Working from home Decent salary Supportive of educational endeavors
cons: Could benefit from an annual training budget for teams to improve skills and boost knowledge that can be for a team or individual professional goals
Some managers have no diplomacy, tact or are not capable of doing the job

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Richmond, Victoria
pros: Lovely people and great work with a supportive culture, challenging work at times so you need to be strong to deal with some of the issues.
cons: Challenging work that can get you down

pros: Other carers are fantastic and the kids are also amazing.
cons: Completely shambolic upper management. Lack of support for staff and mistreatment of young people in care is rife. Not safe working conditions or living conditions for the kids.

pros: Great PD opportunities and internal training.
cons: Limited space to move and grow.
Lots of changes happening in all areas
the pressure sometimes is a bit much

pros:
Fun

Culturally diverse
Energising culture with many great people to work alongside
cons: They haven't always made people feel valued for their service

pros:
The people were great
The kids were wonderful

cons: No scheduled breaks regardless of shift length.

pros: the teamwork and meeting with new people
cons: There we no cons at all

pros: Berry Street is a great place to work, they always look out for there clients and employees,A great place to work, very client focused and professional. Great supports and supervision

The hardest part of the job was dealing with the workload,, the limits tools and resources due to budget constraints

review_title: Very inclusive work place with great leadership
job_title: Alcohol and Drug Counselor in Melbourne
pros:
Supportive management 
Autonomy 
Great culture 
Progressive with the work they do
cons: The only con is that I started in the middle of pandemic and therefore have not been able to meet any of my colleagues in person as I am working from home.

review_title: Do not work for this company
pros: Very few pros. Some of the people you work with in the residential unit are ok. Some have your back, others are just out for themselves and will make stuff up about other staff so the kids like them.
cons: Management. Policies, makes you unable to do any good work with the kids. Mangement. Low pay. Oh and Management. ZERO support.

pros: Environment, self care, professional development, car park
cons: Lack of progression, professional progression, visibility of leadership
